inbodydescription.para: CAN2 GPIO Configuration PB5 ---> CAN2_RX PB6 ---> CAN2_TX
CAN2 GPIO Configuration PB5 ---> CAN2_RX PB6 ---> CAN2_TX

detaileddescription.para: This function is the canonical team method of sending a CAN message. It invokes the canTxDaemon, to avoid any conflicts due to a context switch mid transmission Is it a little bit convoluted? Yes. Is that worth it? Still yes.

inbodydescription.para: Check that the CAN Tx daemon is actually active

briefdescription.para: Background task that handles any CAN messages that are being sent.

detaileddescription.para: This task sits idle, until the time is right (it receives a notification from the uvSendCanMSG function) Once this condition has been met, it will actually call the HAL_CAN_AddTxMessage function. This is a very high priority task, meaning that it will pause whatever other code is going in order to run

briefdescription.para: This file provides code for the configuration of the CAN instances.
